update.description:
Several things:

1. We just made a prerelease of `libsdformat3` for use with the default branch of gazebo. Since we are using `find_package(SDFormat 2)` and sdformat's cmake config file is using `SameMajorVersion`, it won't accept sdformat3. So I add `find_package(SDFormat 3)` if the first one fails.

2. sdformat behavior was changed in 2.3.1 to [ignore unknown elements](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/148/ignore-unknown-elements/diff). This causes a `UNIT_msgs_TEST` failure, which I fix here. I also bumped the minimum sdformat2 version to 2.3.1 to ensure that the test will pass.

3. Make `INTEGRATION_factory` a DRI test, since it uses a pr2 with a camera. It has been [failing in the non-GPU jenkins jobs](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64/1250/testReport/junit/(root)/INTEGRATION_factory/test_ran/).

4. Fix SDF shasums in `UNIT_gz_TEST`. It's annoying to fix these all the time (#1332), and it occurred to me that we could move the `gz sdf` tool functionality to a separate command-line tool in the sdformat repository ([sdformat issue 85](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issue/85/gz-sdf-command-line-tool-should-be-in)), which would make it easier to keep the test in sync with the sdformat description.

I'll update with Jenkins results as available.
update.title: gazebo5: allow sdformat3 and fix tests

I'll update with Jenkins results as available.
update.title: gazebo5: allow sdformat3 and fix tests

pull_request.title: gazebo5: allow sdformat3 and fix tests

pullrequest.title: gazebo5: allow sdformat3 and fix tests

content.raw:
`gz_TEST.cc` was added in pull request #972 (warning, big pull request). The initial goal was to have tests for all the command-line tools. For `gzsdf` (now known as `gz sdf`), one of the desired tests was to verify that it properly printed the entire sdformat description (`gz sdf -d 1.4` for example). To verify this, the entire sdformat description was copied into a [header file](#!/osrf/gazebo/raw/b45e99a4c98dc0ae075b66f4b60f5c17aa6c424b/test/data/sdf_descriptions_expected.h) and a [string comparison was made](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/b45e99a4c98dc0ae075b66f4b60f5c17aa6c424b/tools/gz_TEST.cc?at=gzmodify#cl-601).

I had my own issues about the basic idea of that test (#1332), but storing the entire description as text had some impractical side effects. Without detailing those, we instead compute a `shasum` of the generated sdf description and compare to a hard-coded value.

I don't know of a table of sdformat compatibility.
content.html:
gz_TEST.cc was added in pull request #972 (warning, big pull request). The initial goal was to have tests for all the command-line tools. For gzsdf (now known as gz sdf), one of the desired tests was to verify that it properly printed the entire sdformat description (gz sdf -d 1.4 for example). To verify this, the entire sdformat description was copied into a header file and a string comparison was made.

I had my own issues about the basic idea of that test (#1332), but storing the entire description as text had some impractical side effects. Without detailing those, we instead compute a shasum of the generated sdf description and compare to a hard-coded value.

I don't know of a table of sdformat compatibility.
